source.title: Ten year anniversary charge (pre-November 2015 rules) - George's trust

testCase.description: 10-year charge using pre-Nov 2015 rules (includes non-relevant property)
testCase.scenario: George's trust reaches 10-year anniversary before 18 November 2015. Under old rules, non-relevant property is included in notional transfer calculation. Trust has £1,000,000 relevant property, related settlements £200,000, and non-relevant property £150,000.

calculationNotes: For anniversaries before 18 November 2015, non-relevant property is included
Step 5: Calculate tax (on RELEVANT property only)
Note: Non-relevant property affects RATE calculation but tax applies only to relevant property
Actual charge £56,622 < £60,000, so no capping required
hmrcQuote: George's notional lifetime transfer totaled £1,350,000 (including related settlements and non-relevant property). With only £76,000 nil rate band remaining, the effective rate was 18.874%, giving an anniversary rate of 5.662%. Tax on £1,000,000 relevant property: £56,620.
